components.content: We welcome your views on the registration service. If you agree to be contacted by answering "yes" below, you will be consenting to share your personal data - name, email address, telephone number and service received - with our independent partner research agency, IFF research. You may withdraw your consent at any stage by email Consular.research@fco.gov.uk. For more details on how your data will be handled in relation to feedback please see the research privacy policy at www.gov.uk/fco/tell-fco.

components.content: If you’re a British national getting a marriage or civil partnership abroad, you might need certain documents from the UK government, for example a certificate of no impediment (CNI).
Use this tool to find out how to get the documents you’ll need.
You’ll need to contact the local authorities where you want to get married to find out what you need to do.
Your marriage or civil partnership will be recognised in the UK if both of the following apply:

• you followed the correct process in the country where you got married
  • it would be allowed under UK law
There’s a separate guide if you want to get married or enter into a civil partnership in the UK.

components.name: countryPicker
components.title: Where do you want to get married?

pages.title: What type of ceremony are you planning?

components.name: ceremony
components.title: What type of ceremony are you planning?

components.content: Before you get married

Contact the civil registry office where you’re planning to get married to find out about local marriage laws, including what documents you and your partner will need.

One of you must live in Spain or be a Spanish national.

The civil registry office will ask for one or both of the following:
  • Certificate of no impediment
  • Marital status certificate

If your partner is British they’ll need to make a separate application to the consulate with the same certificates. If they’re not British they’ll need equivalent documents from their local authorities.
Get married

You can have a civil wedding or a religious wedding. Religious ceremonies aren’t valid on their own. You’ll need to have a civil wedding as well.

Civil weddings

Take your certificates to the civil registry office where you’re planning to get married. The registrar will check your documents and set a date for your wedding.

Religious weddings

Take your certificates to the priest who’s going to marry you. The priest will check your documents and set a date for your wedding. After your ceremony either you or the priest must register your marriage at the local civil registry office. You won’t be legally married until this has happened.
After you get married

Your marriage will be recognised in the UK if:

  • you follow the correct process according to the law in Spain
  • it would be allowed under UK law

It’s not possible to register your marriage in the UK.

If your partner isn’t a British citizen, they can apply for British citizenship once they’ve lived in the UK for 3 years.
Add a photo of the main page of your British passport - the page with the passport photo. We accept almost all file formats and sizes.

components.title: How to photograph your document
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

pages.title: Add a photo of your passport

components.content: I hereby declare that the information given is correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

Add a photo of a proof of your address. It could be one of the following five options:

  • electoral role confirmation letter
  • utility bills (not printed off the internet) / building society/savings bank passbook
  • bank/building society/credit card statement (not ones printed off the internet)
  • mortgage statement /council tax demand / credit reference agency search
  • recent evidence of entitlement to state or local authority-funded benefit, tax credit, pension, educational or other grant

  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

components.content: If you are British citizen but don't have a UK passport, you can't apply online to get married in France. Please contact the British consulate in Paris to continue your application.

pages.title: Non-UK passport holders need to apply for this service offline

components.content:
You won’t be able to save your application – get this information ready before you continue.

You can take as long as you need to fill in this section but if there is no activity for 20 minutes, such as filling in a field or clicking next, it will timeout and the information entered will be lost.

You will need to provide the following information:

• Name of authority in Spain (civil registry, court etc.) requesting the certificate from the British Consulate/li>
  • Date of appointment to submit paperwork to the authority in Spain. (approximate date)
  • Date and place of the ceremony

You will need to take pictures of the following documents to later upload:

  • Your UK passport
  • Long birth certificate
  • Proof of address

components.title: Which documents can be used as proof of address?
components.content:
• electoral role confirmation letter
  • utility bills (not printed off the internet) / building society/savings bank passbook
  • bank/building society/credit card statement (not ones printed off the internet)
  • mortgage statement /council tax demand / credit reference agency search
  • recent evidence of entitlement to state or local authority-funded benefit, tax credit, pension, educational or other grant
Add a photo of your long British birth certificate. The full version of the certificate shows the names of your parents.

components.title: How to photograph your documents
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

pages.title: Do you need a marital status certificate?

components.name: needMSC
components.title: Do you need a marital status certificate?

pages.title: Apply for the certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate

components.content:
In the following process you will apply to exchange your UK-issued CNI for one that’s valid in Spain and to receive a marital status certificate.

The certificates cost £50 each, which will be a total of £100.

The consulate will send both certificates and original documents to you by courier. You’ll usually get your certificates 30 working days after the consulate receives your supporting documents.

Your new CNI will be valid for 6 months from when your original CNI was issued.

lists.name: Documents
lists.title: What documents do you have that prove you're a British citizen?

items.text: Your local birth certificate, your parent's British birth certificate and your parent's marriage certificate (if applicable)
items.value: Local birth certificate, you're parent's British birth certificate and your parent's marriage certificate (if applicable)

items.text: Your Home Office Certificate of Naturalisation or Registration
items.value: Home Office Certificate of Naturalisation or Registration

lists.name: whereShouldWeSendCertificate
lists.title: Where should we send the certificate

items.text: Give notice of marriage at your local registry office in the UK
items.value: Give notice of marriage at your local registry office in the UK
items.description: A notice of marriage takes between 28 and 29 days in the UK. You will need this document for your Spanish certificate of no impediment

items.text: Get your affirmation notarised by a notary in Spain
items.value: Get your affirmation notarised by a notary in Spain
items.description: You have  to swear an affirmation in front of a notary. You will need this document for your marital status certificate

items.text: Apply for the certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate
items.value: Apply for the certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate

items.description: This includes the originals of your notice of marriage, your affirmation, and, in case you are divorced or widowed, your decree absolute or death certificate of your late partner

items.text: Book appointment at a Spanish registry office
items.value: Book appointment at a Spanish registry office
